title: Must-See 21 Real Estate “This or That” Post Ideas
excerpt: Social media is a must for real estate agents looking to connect with clients and build their brand. One particularly effective strategy? “This or That”…
content:
Social media is a must for real estate agents looking to connect with clients and build their brand. One particularly effective strategy? “This or That” real estate posts. These social media marketing posts present two options and invite followers to choose their favorite, sparking engagement and discussion and ultimately helping you with real estate lead generation.

In this blog, we’ll explain everything you need to know about “this or that” posts. Even better, we’ve already created many of them, and they’re free for you to download and use.

Incorporating “This or That” real estate posts into your social media strategy can enhance your online presence, build trust with your audience, and gain a deeper understanding of what your clients are looking for in a home.

Defining a “This or That” Real Estate Post
“This or That” Post Benefits

Creating Effective “This or That” Real Estate Posts

Download Real Estate This or That Posts For Free
Real Estate This or That Posts: Home Features

Real Estate This or That Posts: Location Preferences

Real Estate This or That Posts: Lifestyle Choices

Posting Your “This or That”

Maximizing Your Social Media Reach
How to Post an Interactive “This or That” Real Estate Post

Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty
Downloads
FAQ’s

Defining a “This or That” Real Estate Post

Let’s start with the basics. A “This or That” real estate post is a simple, engaging way to connect with your audience. Imagine asking a fun, relatable question like, “Which do you prefer?” followed by “Jacuzzi or Pool?” These posts feature eye-catching images to make the choices clear and appealing.

Agents typically post these questions to their social media stories, where viewers can quickly tap to vote, and to their static social media posts, where the comment section becomes a lively debate. Whether it’s a story poll or a static post, these questions are designed to spark engagement and get your followers talking.

“This or That” Post Benefits

More Comments

Interactive posts get more comments and shares. “This or That” real estate posts are perfect for this because they invite your followers to participate actively. Studies show that interactive content like these posts can generate up to 59% more engagement than static posts. More engagement means your posts are seen by more people, and that’s always a win!

People Love Them

Who doesn’t love to voice their opinion? Polls and quizzes are a hit online because they’re fun and easy to join. “This or That” real estate posts present choices side by side, making it easy for people to decide and share their preferences. This not only gives people a chance to be heard but also breaks down complex topics into simple, bite-sized comparisons.

Community Building

When people share their choices, they feel part of a community. They get to see what others prefer and why, turning the comment section into a lively discussion. This exchange of views adds depth to the conversation and makes the topic more engaging and personal. It’s a great way to create a sense of community and involvement among your followers.

More Traffic

More interaction means more visibility for your social media posts. The more people comment and share, the more your content spreads across social media. This increased reach can drive more traffic to your profile and listings, helping you connect with more prospects in your real estate market.

Great Information

“These posts aren’t just for fun—they’re also a valuable source of information. By sparking conversations, agents can learn about client preferences and desires. This insight helps you tailor your services to better meet client needs, leading to stronger relationships and more successful transactions.

The Power of Two Choices

One reason “This or That” posts work so well is that they leverage the psychology of choice. The psychology of choice suggests that when people have too many options, they become overwhelmed and less likely to make a decision. By presenting just two choices, these posts simplify the decision-making process and encourage followers to share their opinions.

Creating Effective “This or That” Real Estate Posts

Ready to create your own engaging “This or That” posts? Here are the key elements:

Understanding Your Audience

Knowing your audience is crucial. They have specific needs and preferences, so tailor your posts to resonate with them. For instance, if your audience consists of young professionals, focus on modern design elements. The more you understand what your audience loves, the better you can engage them.

Keeping the Posts Visually Appealing

People love looking at beautiful photos, and high-quality posts are more likely to stand out. Use high-quality images and vibrant colors to make your posts eye-catching. Tools like Canva can help you create professional and visually appealing graphics with ease. Remember, a visually stunning post is more likely to grab attention and encourage engagement.

Asking Relevant and Timely Questions

Align your posts with current trends or seasons to keep them relevant. For example, during summer, you could ask, “Beach view or Mountain view?” This not only makes the question timely but also maximizes engagement by tapping into seasonal preferences. Relevant and timely questions are more likely to spark interest and conversation among your followers.

By focusing on these elements, you’ll create “This or That” posts that are not only engaging but also highly effective in connecting with your audience

Download Real Estate This or That Posts For Free

You can find the download options at the bottom of the page or in the sidebar. You have two options: download the Canva template to easily customize it yourself, or download these exact posts as they are. Enter your email, and it will be sent there (Check your spam if you don’t see it).

Real Estate This or That Posts: Home Features

Below you will find caption examples for each real estate this or that post. Feel free to simply copy and paste them for your own use!

1. Pool View or Lake View

Caption:

Pool or Lake View???

Views are a major factor in property desirability. Pool views offer a sense of luxury and resort-style living, while lake views provide a tranquil and natural setting. #RealEstate #LuxuryLiving #DreamHome

2. Carpet or Hardwood Flooring

Caption:

Carpet or Hardwood Flooring? ??

Flooring preferences can vary widely. Carpets add warmth and comfort, ideal for bedrooms and cozy spaces, while hardwood flooring offers elegance and durability, perfect for high-traffic areas. #InteriorDesign #HomeImprovement #FlooringTrends

3. Bright Cabinets or Dark Cabinets

Caption:

Bright or Dark Cabinets? ??

Kitchen aesthetics are key in home design. Bright cabinets can make a space feel larger and more welcoming, while dark cabinets add sophistication and a modern touch. #KitchenDesign #HomeRenovation #InteriorStyling

4. Hot Tub or Pool

Caption:

Hot Tub or Pool? ??

Outdoor amenities greatly influence home-buying decisions. Hot tubs are perfect for relaxation and can be used year-round, while pools are excellent for family fun and exercise. #BackyardOasis #PoolVsHotTub #OutdoorLiving

5. Granite Countertops or Marble Countertops

Caption:

Granite or Marble Countertops? ??

Countertop materials are often debated among homeowners. Granite is known for its durability and variety, while marble is prized for its luxurious look and unique veining. #KitchenDesign #CountertopDebate #HomeRenovation

6. Light Rooms or Bold Rooms

Caption:

Light Rooms or Bold Rooms? ??

Room colors set the tone for the entire home. Light rooms create an airy, open feel that can make spaces seem larger, while bold rooms make a statement and add personality. #InteriorDesign #HomeDecor #LivingRoomInspiration

7. Infinity Pool or Glass Bottom Pool

Caption:

Infinity Pool or Glass Bottom Pool? ??

Unique pool features can be a major selling point. Infinity pools offer breathtaking views and a seamless blend with the horizon, while glass-bottom pools provide a unique underwater experience. #LuxuryPools #PoolDesign #DreamPools

8. Home Gym or Sauna

Caption:

Home Gym or Sauna? ?????

Health and wellness spaces are becoming increasingly important. Home gyms cater to fitness enthusiasts who prefer the convenience of working out at home, while saunas offer a retreat for relaxation and health benefits. #WellnessJourney #FitnessVsRelaxation #HomeHealth

9. Batman Theme or Iron Man Theme

Caption:

Batman or Iron Man Theme? ??

Themed rooms can add a fun and personalized touch to a home. A Batman-themed room might appeal to fans of the dark, mysterious aesthetic, while an Iron Man-themed room offers a high-tech, futuristic vibe. #SuperheroStyle #BatmanVsIronMan #HeroHomes

10. Garden or Grass Lawn

Caption:

Garden or Grass Lawn? ??

Choosing between a garden and a grass lawn involves weighing benefits and aesthetics. Grass lawns offer a surface perfect for recreation and a manicured look. Gardens allow for growing flowers, shrubs, and vegetables, boosting biodiversity and reducing maintenance. Gardens also require less water and fewer herbicides. #GardenVsLawn #LandscapingIdeas #EcoFriendlyYard

11. Black and Gold or White and Silver

Caption:

Black and Gold or White and Silver? ??

Color schemes play a crucial role in home decor. Black and gold exude luxury and opulence, while white and silver provide a clean, modern look. #InteriorDesignTrends #LuxuryLiving #DesignInspiration

Real Estate This or That Posts: Location Preferences

12. Condo or Suburb

Caption:

Condo or Suburb? ??

Living environments significantly impact daily life. Condos offer urban convenience and amenities, while suburban homes provide more space and a quieter lifestyle. #UrbanVsSuburban #LivingChoices #HomeDecisions

13. Beach View or Mountain View

Caption:

Beach or Mountain View? ??

Scenic views are a top consideration for many buyers. Beach views offer a relaxing, coastal atmosphere, while mountain views provide a serene, natural backdrop. #NatureViews #BeachVsMountain #DreamHomeViews

14. Rural Town or City Life

Caption:

Rural Town or City Life? ????

Lifestyle choices often depend on location. Rural towns offer peace and space, ideal for those seeking a slower pace, while city life is vibrant and full of amenities. #CityVsCountry #UrbanVsRural #LivingChoices

15. Vacation Home or Primary Home Remodel

Caption:

Vacation Home or Home Remodel? ??

Investment decisions vary widely among homeowners. Some may prefer to purchase a vacation home for getaway purposes, while others might opt to remodel their primary home for enhanced daily living. #HomeRenovation #VacationHome #PropertyInvestment

Real Estate This or That Posts: Lifestyle Choices

16. Patio or Balcony

Caption:

Patio or Balcony? ??

Outdoor spaces enhance living experiences. Patios provide a larger area for entertaining and gardening, while balconies offer a cozy spot with a view. #OutdoorLiving #PatioVsBalcony #HomeDesign

17. Mansion or Yacht

Caption:

Mansion or Yacht? ??

Luxury living can take different forms. Mansions offer expansive space and grand architecture, while yachts provide luxury on the water with the freedom to travel. #LuxuryLiving #DreamLife #WealthLifestyle

18. Home Office or Guest Room

Caption:

Home Office or Guest Room? ??

Functional spaces are important in home design. Home offices cater to remote work needs, offering a dedicated space for productivity, while guest rooms provide comfort for visitors. #InteriorDesign #GuestRoomOrOffice #HomeDesign

19. Basement or Attic

Caption:

Basement or Attic? ??

Extra space is always a plus in a home. Basements can be turned into recreational areas or additional living spaces, while attics offer storage or cozy retreats. #HomeImprovement #BasementVsAttic #RenovationIdeas

20. New Construction or Historic Home

Caption:

New Construction or Historic Home? ?

Preferences for home styles can vary greatly. New constructions offer modern amenities and energy efficiency, while historic homes provide charm and unique architectural details. #ModernVsHistoric #DreamHome #HouseHunting

21. Modern Home or Contemporary Style Home

Caption:

Modern or Contemporary Home? ?

Modern homes emphasize clean lines, minimalism, and functionality rooted in early to mid-20th-century design. Contemporary homes, however, incorporate current trends, innovative materials, and sustainable practices. #ModernDesign #ContemporaryStyle #HomeTrends

Posting Your “This or That”

Posts versus Instagram Stories Benefits

When it comes to sharing your “This or That” content, you have options: Instagram or Facebook stories, static posts, or both. Each has its own strengths, so let’s break it down.

Posts

Posts are static and remain on your account, providing long-term visibility. Viewers can interact by answering the question in a comment, which can spark ongoing discussions. Posts are great because they can be seen by anyone, not just your followers, which helps broaden your reach.

Stories

Stories, on the other hand, offer a more dynamic experience. Users can tap their screen to answer questions, making stories more interactive. However, stories disappear after 24 hours and are only seen by your followers, so they don’t have the lasting visibility of posts.

Maximizing Your Social Media Reach

For maximum impact, start with a Instagram or Facebook post. It’s a quick way to engage your followers and get immediate responses. Then, a few days later, share the post to your story. This strategy gives you the best of both worlds. You get the lasting visibility of a post and, sometime later, the poll interaction of a story that may be an audience that missed your original post.

By using both posts and stories, you can maximize your reach and ensure your content gets seen by a broader audience.

How to Post an Interactive “This or That” Real Estate Post

Ready to get your “This or That” posts up and running? Follow these simple steps to use our free downloads and engage your audience like never before.

Steps to Use Our Free Download of “This or That” Posts

Download Smart Agent alliance Images or Template

  1. Images: After hitting the ““Download “This or That” Posts” button, open the email you receive on your phone that has the download link. Extract the files from the zip folder.
  2. Template: After hitting the “Download Canva Post Template” button, open the email you receive. Click the link and copy & paste the text into a web browser. Hit “edit template” and drag and drop your own pictures in Canva. If you don’t have a Canva account, open a free version account.

Posting on Instagram

  1. Create a Post:
    • Open your Instagram account and tap the + sign to create a new post.
    • Select a “This or That” image from your gallery and hit Next.
    • Want to add music? Tap the music notes, choose a song, and hit the check sign. Then hit Next again.
  2. Add a Caption:
    • For easy creation, copy our ready-made corresponding caption from Smart Agent Alliance.
    • Add local hashtags and your location to increase visibility. Then, hit Share.

Sharing as a Story

  1. Create a Poll on Instagram:
    • Open Instagram, find your post, and tap the kite sign.
    • Choose Add to Story.
  2. Create a Story Without Posting First:
    • If you prefer not to create the post first, hit the + sign and choose Story.
    • Tap the picture icon in the lower-left corner to open your phone gallery and select a “This or That” image.

Adding a Poll Sticker

  1. Tap the Sticker Icon:
    • It looks like a smiley face at the top of the screen.
    • Scroll down and select the Poll sticker.
  2. Customize Your Poll:
    • Type in your question, like “Which do you prefer?” and replace the default “Yes” and “No” with your own options.
    • Add emojis to each option to make it more engaging. Hit Done.
  3. Position and Style Your Poll:
    • Adjust the size and placement of the poll sticker—we suggest making it smaller and centering it on the image.
    • Change the color to match your brand by tapping on the color palette icon.
  4. Share Your Poll:
    • Tap the arrow in the lower right corner to simultaneously share your Instagram story to your Facebook story.
    • Hit Share and then Done.

Sharing to a Post

  1. Share Your Story as a Post:
    • View your story by tapping your icon. In the story, hit the three dots labeled More and choose Share as Post.
    • Hit Next twice and add a caption.
    • For easy creation, copy our ready-made corresponding caption from Smart Agent Alliance. Add local hashtags, your location, and music, then hit Share.

And there you go! You’re all set to engage your audience with fun and interactive “This or That” posts.

Share Results

Once your poll has ended, it’s time to share the results with your followers. They’ll love seeing which option won and how their vote contributed.

Viewing and Sharing Instagram Results

  1. View Your Results:
    • Open your Instagram and view your own story.
    • Swipe up or tap the Seen by button in the lower-left corner. This will show you who voted and how many votes each option received.
  2. Share the Results:
    • Tap the Share Results button to show your followers the outcome of the poll.
    • Alternatively, you can take a screenshot of the poll results and post it as a new story or static post.

Commenting on the Outcome

Whether you choose to share results or take a screenshot of the poll results, make sure to comment on the outcome. Here are a few ideas:

  • Reflect on the Feedback: Share your thoughts on why one option might have been more popular.
  • Engage with Your Followers: Ask for additional feedback or opinions based on the poll results.
  • Create Follow-Up Content: Use the results to inspire your next “This or That” post or another type of engaging content.

Sharing the results not only keeps your followers engaged but also shows that you value their input. Ready to keep the conversation going? Let’s get those results posted!

That’s a Wrap

“This or That” posts are an effective way for real estate professionals to engage with clients on social media. These posts present two options, inviting followers to share their preferences, which sparks engagement and discussions.

By understanding your audience, using high-quality visuals, and asking relevant questions, you can maximize interaction and build a sense of community. We provided step-by-step instructions for using our free downloadable posts and creating your own content.

With ideas ranging from city versus suburb to high-tech versus eco-friendly homes, these posts help agents gain valuable insights into client preferences and drive successful transactions. Start boosting your social media presence today with these fun and interactive posts!

Not only will you be joining the ONLY profitable public brokerage in the past 5 years that agents rank as the best brokerage to work for, but you’ll also benefit from double the free resources (two teams in your upline) designed to help you succeed quickly and efficiently at eXp. 

With the Wolf Pack, you’ll enjoy exclusive access to the Wolf Pack weekly webinars, the Social Agent Academy for social media training, the Wolf Pack Hub for easy onboarding, Investor Army for investing and flipping houses training.

FAQ’s

What are some real estate hashtags?

#realestate #property #homesforsale #homeowner #newlisting #openhouse #realestateagent #dreamhomeu #househunting #justlisted

What’s a “this or that” real estate post?

A “This or That” real estate post is where you ask a simple relatable question like, “Which do you prefer?” followed by “Jacuzzi or Pool?” Agents typically post these questions to their social media stories, where viewers can quickly tap to vote, and to their static social media posts, where the comment section becomes a lively debate.

Why do “this or that” real estate posts?

Interactive posts get more comments and shares. This or That real estate posts are perfect for this because they invite your followers to participate actively. Studies show that interactive content like these posts can generate up to 59% more engagement than static posts. More engagement means your posts are seen by more people, and that’s always a win!

How can I make my “This or That” real estate post effective?

Here are the key elements: 1. Understanding Your Audience. Knowing your audience is crucial. They have specific needs and preferences, so tailor your posts to resonate with them. 2. Keeping the Posts Visually Appealing. People love looking at beautiful photos, and high-quality posts are more likely to stand out. 3. Asking Relevant and Timely Questions. Align your posts with current trends or seasons to keep them relevant.

title: Real Estate Buyer Agent Consultation: Secrets to Win in 2025
excerpt: Navigating the new rules of real estate can feel like a fresh start rather than a hurdle. When the NAR rules kick in on August…
content:
Navigating the new rules of real estate can feel like a fresh start rather than a hurdle. When the NAR rules kick in on August 17, 2024, transparency becomes the name of the game. Buyers will now sign contracts that clearly outline their agent’s fees – no more hidden costs rolled into the MLS listings.

This means, as a buyer agent, it’s critical to communicate these changes, justify your value, and explain the buyer agent contract. But, no worries! You’ll handle it all during your buyer agent presentation and appointment with your prospective client.

Hey, this isn’t really new territory. Listing agents have always had to justify their value and secure contracts. Now, buyer agents must step up and do the same.

Whether you’re an experienced agent or a newbie, we’ve got your back with this comprehensive look at buyer agent presentations. You’ve got this! Here’s your handy dandy index:

  • New NAR Rule Explained
  • Winning Buyer Agent Presentations
  • Buyer Agent Appointment Prep
  • Buyer Agent Appointment – Show Time
  • Post Buyer Agent Appointment
  • Compensation Choices
  • That’s a Wrap
  • Join our FREE Team at eXp Realty
  • FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

New NAR Rule Explained

On August 17, 2024, the National Association of Realtors (NAR) is implementing its big change for buyer agents. From then on, before you can tour homes with clients, you’ll need a written agreement in place that clearly spells out your agency and fees. Yikes! That’s something most buyer agents haven’t done in a very long time.

No worries, the task doesn’t have to be daunting! As a buyer agent, it’s merely time to fine-tune your approach. All you’ll need to do is be clear and upfront with clients. Think detailed buyer presentations that lay it all out before the house hunting even starts.

Winning Buyer Agent Presentations

It’s time to elevate your buyer agent presentation. Forget about those days when a few general bullet points were enough to win over new clients. Now, with clients needing to sign an agreement to pay you even if the home seller doesn’t, they’ll want detailed information about your services.

Showcase the hard work you do behind the scenes. Educate your buyer clients on the value you bring and the effort you put in that often goes unnoticed. It’s your chance to highlight your expertise and dedication, ensuring they understand exactly what they’re getting when they choose you as their agent.

Buyer Agent Presentation Components

In general, all buyer presentations will include you:

  • Introducing Yourself & Your Unique Value Proposition
  • Introducing Your Brokerage & the Home Buying Process

Besides doing those, in these changing times, also plan to add sections about:

  • How Agents Get Paid
  • Pledges and Requests
  • Buyer Contracts

Let’s look at how you can make each of these most compelling.

Agent Introduction

Let’s kick things off by introducing yourself with a burst of enthusiasm! Start with something like: “Hi there, I’m Karrie Hill and I’m absolutely passionate about real estate!”

Next, share a bit about your background to build a connection. For example, “I got into real estate after a rewarding career in law because I realized my true calling was helping people find their dream homes. There’s nothing like the happiness on a client’s face when they find ‘the one.’”

Add a personal touch by mentioning your hobbies or community involvement. For instance, “When I’m not busy showing homes, you’ll find me hiking the beautiful Marin County trails with my two little dogs, Baxter and Lily, or volunteering at the local animal shelter. I love giving back to the community and connecting with nature.”

These personal details make you relatable and showcase your dedication to both your clients and your community. It’s all about creating that warm, trustworthy first impression!

Your Unique Value Proposition

Next, let’s talk about what sets you apart from the competition. Your unique value proposition (UVP) is all about defining and showcasing what makes you the go-to agent for buyers. It’s about highlighting the specific benefits and services you offer that directly address your clients’ needs and pain points.

Start by clearly articulating what you do for your clients, how it benefits them, and why they should choose you over others. For example, you might highlight your extensive experience, deep market knowledge, legal & construction background, savvy use of technology, or innovative approaches to finding the perfect home.

Here are some key elements to include:

Certifications

Highlight any professional certifications you hold. Like being a Certified Residential Specialist (CRS) or Accredited Buyer’s Representative (ABR). These certifications boost your credibility and reassure clients of your expertise. Don’t have any? No worries. Go to the National Association of Realtors and take some certified courses online.

Experience

Leverage your experience if you’ve been an agent for years or tap into your team’s or brokerage’s collective expertise if you’re newer. Mention specific achievements or milestones to show your credibility.

For instance, say, “With over 10 years in the industry, I’ve helped hundreds of families find their dream homes.” Or highlight team success with, “Our team sold $3.5 billion in real estate last year.”

You can also emphasize your brokerage’s reach like “eXp Realty helps more families buy and sell homes than any other independent brokerage.”

Agent Metrics

This is where you can really shine! Do the math and find impressive metrics to show your value. Use your team or brokerage stats if you don’t have personal numbers yet. Here are some key metrics to highlight:

  • Savings: “On average, I save my clients $5,000 through smart negotiations and concessions.”
  • Efficiency: “Most of my clients find their home after touring just five properties.”
  • Speed: “My average client finds a home and closes the deal within 45 days.”
  • Success Rate: “I have an 85% offer acceptance rate, ensuring you get the home you want.”
  • Brokerage or Team Success: “Our brokerage has a track record of selling homes 20% faster than the market average.”

Testimonials

Include glowing testimonials from satisfied clients. For example, “John and Jane Doe said, ‘Working with Karrie Hill was a game-changer. She found us the perfect home and saved us thousands!’”

Getting these fantastic testimonials is easier than you think. Ask for them when your clients are happiest, whether that’s after seeing homes, finding the perfect one, or getting into contract. Don’t wait until after closing, as clients are often busy with their move and less engaged. Make it simple for them by sending a link to leave a Google review. This way, you capture their positive feedback when it’s fresh and enthusiastic.

Brokerage Introduction

Now that you’ve covered why clients should work with you, add a bit of brokerage magic to your presentation. Introduce your brokerage and explain why you chose to work with them. Highlight special tech, support, tools, or access to off-market properties that your brokerage brings to the table.

For example, you might say, “I chose to work with eXp Realty because of their cutting-edge technology and unparalleled support. Our brokerage offers exclusive tools that help me find the best deals, including access to off-market properties that other agents can’t provide. Plus, our team is backed by a network of experienced professionals ready to assist 24/7 with every step of the home-buying process.”

The Home Buying Process

Alright, this is the meat of traditional buyer agent appointments. Typically, agents talk about steps to home buying, like:

  • Set a Budget
  • Search for Homes
  • Tour Homes
  • Make an Offer
  • Negotiate and Contract
  • Work During Escrow
  • Closing Day

But let’s up your game! For each step, don’t miss the chance to explain what you do behind the scenes. Your clients don’t know all the work you put in, and now with contracts that clearly state your pay, you need to explain what you do to earn it.

Reasonable people don’t mind paying for value when they understand it. So, expand each traditional step with a list of your behind-the-scenes work.

Are you not sure what you do at each step? Write it down during your next transaction, or use guides like NAR’s “179 Ways Agents Who Are Realtors Are Worth Every Penny of Their Compensation” and “105 More Ways” to detail your efforts. Make sure to explain terms and what clients should expect at each stage.

Don’t forget to highlight key steps that buyers care about most. For example, explain how you strategize and negotiate deals. Clients want agents who can get them the house they want at the best price.

Show clients every step you take to make their home-buying experience seamless and valuable. They’ll appreciate the transparency and the effort you put into earning your commission.

How Agents Get Paid

Alright, now that your clients will be paying you directly, it’s super important they get the real scoop on how you’re compensated. You know, that big commission check? Most folks don’t realize it’s not all going into your pocket.

Let’s clear that up before anyone jumps to the conclusion you’re taking home the whole pie. Transparency here will help your clients appreciate the hustle behind your service. They’ll understand why every dollar counts! Here’s a simple way to explain it:

Contingency-Based Income

Think of agent pay like lawyers who work on contingency and only get paid when they win your case. Typically agents also only get paid if a deal closes. This means you work for free and no earnings are guaranteed. It’s all or nothing. It’s a high-risk, high-reward setup where your payoff compensates for the many hours you may invest without a return.

Commission Split

The commission you earn on closing a deal isn’t all yours to keep. A portion of it goes to your brokerage, referral partners, transaction coordinators, and sometimes others too. Your commission check is a team effort!

Out-of-Pocket Expenses

Unlike a typical 9-to-5 job where the company picks up the tab for business expenses, as a real estate agent, you’re running your own show. You pay marketing costs, travel expenses, continuing education costs, real estate association dues, home access key fees, and much more! Your commission isn’t just profit. It also keeps your business afloat.

Buyer Agent Pledge

Let’s jazz up your buyer agent presentation with a splash of commitment and charm! Throw in a “Pledge to Please” where you lay out your golden promises—total honesty, crystal-clear transparency, and steadfast support from start to finish.

Here’s how to make your pledge stand out: Commit to honest property assessments, guarantee confidentiality, and always put your client’s interests first. Ensure your clients that you will communicate clearly and promptly, disclose any potential conflicts of interest, show all properties that fit your client’s needs, and thoroughly explain all documents before they sign.

This pledge sets clear expectations and showcases your dedication to ethical practices and client satisfaction. It can strengthen your relationships with clients and help you stand out in a crowded market. Staying true to this pledge will build your reputation as a reliable and trustworthy agent, potentially earning you more referrals and repeat business.

Requests of Clients

Want to keep those home tours smooth and professional? Giving your clients a heads-up on these tips makes the process more efficient and cements your reputation as a pro who’s all about respect and transparency. Share these tips with your clients:

Punctuality is Key

Arriving on time keeps the day running smoothly and shows respect for everyone’s busy schedules! Angering a seller by being late won’t help you win the home.

Chatting During Tours

Discussing offers or sensitive details in the house? Not a great idea. You never know if sellers or other buyers are listening in. Keeping negotiations under wraps until you’re in a private setting protects your strategy and maintains confidentiality.

Buyer Contracts

Alright, let’s dive into the heart of the matter: those essential buyer contracts. From August 17th, thanks to the new N.A.R. rules, you’ll need to have a signed buyer agent agreement in place before you show any homes.

But, it’s all good! Navigating contracts with clarity and flexibility demonstrates your professionalism and builds trust and loyalty with your clients. Here’s how you can handle it with flair:

Introducing the Contract

After rocking your buyer presentation, it’s time to chat about the nitty-gritty—signing that contract. This isn’t just paperwork; it’s the blueprint of your relationship with your client. It outlines both parties’ responsibilities and details your compensation.

Flexibility is Key

Everyone loves options, right? Depending on how well you know your client, you could suggest different types of agreements. For a well-acquainted client, think about proposing an exclusive, long-term contract covering any property. For newer clients, maybe start with a non-exclusive, short-term agreement focused on specific areas. This flexibility helps put clients at ease, giving them control over how they commit.

Cancellation Policy

Let’s talk about making exits as smooth as entries. It’s wise to clarify your cancellation policy upfront. Whether it’s a no-fuss immediate cancellation or a more standard 30-day notice, make sure they know their options. Being clear about cancellation terms prevents future headaches and preserves good vibes. This keeps the door open for referrals down the road.

Clarify the Fine Print

Be upfront about what cancellation means. For instance, if a client decides to back out, are they still on the hook for showings you’ve already done? Spell out these details to avoid misunderstandings and ensure everyone is on the same page.

Buyer Agent Appointment Prep

Now that you’ve written an awesome buyer agent presentation, let’s go over how to prepare for your client appointment.

Mindset Mastery

Prepare yourself to step into every client meeting radiating confidence and positivity. It doesn’t matter if the market’s in a slump or soaring. Your job is to assure buyers that they’re on the right track to finding their dream home.

Maintain a positive and professional demeanor reassures your clients and makes them feel more at ease and confident in their decisions. So pump up your positive energy and let it shine. Your vibe can make all the difference in their home-buying experience.

Market Mastery

Brush up on your market mastery. A solid grasp of the current real estate market is key so get ready to quote those stats. Before meeting with clients, update yourself on the latest prices, inventory levels, and market trends.

Demonstrating your knowledge instills confidence in your clients and positions you as an expert they can trust. This prep ensures you’re ready to answer questions with authority and insight.

Buyer Agent Presentation Mastery

Last, review your Buyer Agent Presentation and jazz it up to ensure that it sticks with your clients. You’ve invested a heap of effort into gathering this info, so let’s make sure it captivates and sticks with your clients.

Tech Savvy

First up, dial up your presentation engagement with some slick tech. Consider whipping up a dynamic PowerPoint or a snazzy Canva presentation. Using animations, vibrant photos and creative designs keeps your clients engaged.

Takeaways

Make sure your clients walk away with something tangible. Whether it’s printing out the key points or emailing them the entire presentation, giving them a copy ensures they can revisit the info anytime. This helps reinforce what they’ve learned and keeps you top of mind.

Buyer Agent Appointment – Show Time

Alright, you’re all set for your client meeting. But remember, a stellar client meeting isn’t just about running through your presentation. It’s about engaging actively with your clients, weaving seamless conversations into your pitch to really connect.

Here are some key strategies to keep the dialogue serving your interests:

Client-Centric Communication

Focus on listening more than talking. Engage your clients with open-ended questions to better understand their thoughts and concerns. Adapt your responses and your presentation to meet their specific needs.

Understanding Your Client

Get to know what your clients are really looking for. Don’t just focus on the basic requirements like bedrooms or location; dive into their lifestyle needs, future plans, and personal preferences.

Consider using a Google Form to gather the basic information before the meeting. Then you can focus on the deeper information at the appointment. This is your chance to understand beyond the surface details and into the life they envision in their new home.

Tailoring the Conversation

Customize your discussion based on whether they are experienced homebuyers or first-timers. For seasoned buyers, streamline the process information; for newbies, explain each step carefully to build confidence.

Also, tailor your chats to sync with your buyer’s vibes! Celebrate their milestones like buying their first home or moving cities, and pump it all up the enthusiasm. Tap into their emotions that buying a home involves – stress, excitement, fear, whatever. Show them you get it! Your empathy will ease their nerves and make their home-buying experience better.

Incorporate Stories

Share anecdotes from past clients with similar backgrounds or needs. These stories help current buyers visualize their success and connect more deeply with the process. Emphasize the positive impacts and emotional satisfaction of previous clients.

Post Buyer Agent Appointment

You’ve successfully presented your buyer agent presentation, now what?

Follow Up

After the presentation, you’ll want to check in with potential clients. Ask if they have any questions. This shows them that you are committed. You can also send thank you notes or emails. It’s a nice gesture that can set you apart from others. don’t be afraid to ask them to sign the buyer agent agreement so you can start showing them homes.

All Interactions

Once they become your client, always put your best foot forward. When interacting with them, review their client file to be up on their particular facts and needs. While out looking at homes also focus on educating your buyers, not pushing them to a purchase. Providing them with knowledge empowers buyers and makes them feel valued and respected, keeping the dynamic not a sales transaction but rather an advisory relationship.

Compensation Choices

With all the prior information, you are ready to rock your buyer agent role. However, let’s cover one more thing that might be nagging at you.

That is, now the new N.A.R. rules say your compensation will no longer be a percentage of the sales price offered through the MLS. Without that constraint, buyer agents are likely to make more creative choices about their compensation.

Let’s go over some of those. Of course, all the following ideas are subject to both the rules of your state and your brokerage. So, check on those.

Percentage-Based Commission

You already know this one. This traditional model involves charging a percentage of the home’s sale price, typically between 2.5% to 3% for the buyer’s agent. Let your buyers know that this is what you are paid when a deal closes.

Stick with this percentage-based commission structure if you plan to provide a full suite of services listed in your buyer agent presentation.

Flat Fee Structure

Ideal for high-value property markets, the flat fee model lets buyers sidestep the heftier percentage-based commissions. For a fixed amount – say, $9,999 – buyers can enjoy significant savings, especially on more expensive properties.

You’ll need to clearly define which services you’ll provide in exchange for a flat fee.

Pay Per Service

This a la carte approach allows clients to pay only for the services they use, offering flexibility and potentially lowering costs. It’s crucial to outline what each service entails and ensure the pricing is transparent and fair.

Non-Refundable Retainer Fee

A non-refundable retainer fee can help agents sort out the real buyers from the unmotivated buyers by requiring that they have some skin in the game. This fee secures your services while ensuring you will be paid something for your time even if the client never closes a deal.

The Caveat

Remember, under the new rules, you set the price ceiling on what you can earn.

That means that even if a seller offers a buyer agent more than what you contracted for, you will not get more than your contract amount. This means that if a seller throws in a sweetener that exceeds your agreed-upon fee, you’re still capped at your contract rate – you can’t get more.

However, you’ve still got the freedom to slide those numbers down whenever it suits the situation. Why might you drop your fee? Maybe you wrapped up a deal faster than a New York minute, or perhaps shaving off a few percentage points could rescue a nearly dead deal. Or, you might decide to match a lower offer from a seller just to keep things smooth.

You may want to set your fee high and adjust as needed, giving you the flexibility to adapt to different scenarios. It’s all about making your commission work for you and your client, ensuring everyone walks away happy.

That’s a Wrap

Navigating the buyer agent appointment process just got easier. You’ve learned the ropes from understanding the new NAR rule to nailing your buyer agent presentation.

Would you like an animated, beautiful buyer agent presentation that is already complete? One that you can easily customize to your information and needs?  Join our free eXp Realty team and Smart Agent Alliance has you covered.

Join our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Join the leading force in real estate with eXp Realty – the only profitable publicly traded brokerage over the past five years and holds the prestigious title of the best brokerage to work for. The benefits of eXp Realty are unmatched and will truly exceed your expectations!

When you join us at Smart Agent Alliance, you’ll also be part of the Wolf Pack at eXp Realty.  Together we are one big team and we provide more FREE value than you’ll get anywhere else in the real estate business.

What’s included? Access our exclusive SAA Vault Assets to enhance your business efficiency, attend weekly team video calls filled with invaluable insights and top agent strategies, and receive the Social Agent Academy Program and Investor Army Courses – a combined value of over $1,500 – absolutely free. And that’s just the beginning! Explore more about our robust team benefits.

Don’t let this opportunity pass you by. Transform your real estate career, maximize your income, and secure your future. Contact us now to schedule a video consultation or email us at team@SmartAgentAlliance.com. We’re here to ensure your success.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

What should buyer agents do because of the new NAR rules?

On August 17, 2024, the National Association of Realtors (NAR) is implementing its big change for buyer agents. From then on, before you can tour homes with clients, you’ll need a written agreement in place that clearly spells out your agency and fees. As a buyer agent, you’ll need to do is be clear and upfront with clients. Think detailed buyer presentations that lay it all out before the house hunting starts.

What should be included in a buyer agent presentation?

In general, include some primary information like: Your Introduction Yourself, Your Unique Value Proposition, Your Brokerage Introduction, and The Home Buying Process. Due to the new N.A.R. rules also plan to add sections for: How Agents Get Paid, Pledges and Requests and Buyer Contracts.

What’s a unique value proposition?

This is about defining and showcasing what makes you the go-to agent for buyers. It’s about highlighting the specific benefits and services you offer that directly address your clients’ needs and pain points.

What should I include in my unique value proposition?

Start by clearly articulating what you do for your clients, how it benefits them, and why they should choose you over others. For example, you might highlight your extensive experience, deep market knowledge, legal u0026amp; construction background, savvy use of technology, or innovative approaches to finding the perfect home.

How much do real estate agents keep from their commission?

Typically agents also only get paid if a deal closes. This means they work for free and no earnings are guaranteed. From commission earned, agents pay a portion to their brokerage and they also may pay referral partners, transaction coordinators, and others too. Plus, since unlike a typical 9-to-5 job, real estate agents pay all their own expenses like marketing costs, travel expenses, continuing education costs, real estate association dues, home access key fees, and much more!

How can I improve my buyer agent presentation?

Jazz it up to ensure that it sticks with your clients. First, consider whipping up a dynamic PowerPoint or a snazzy Canva presentation. Using animations, vibrant photos and creative designs keeps your clients engaged. Second, make sure your clients walk away with printed key points or a pdf of entire presentation. This helps reinforce what they’ve learned and keeps you top of mind.

In what ways can agents structure their pay?

With the new N.A.R. rules, buyer agents are likely to make more creative choices about their compensation like the same percentage-based system or flat-fee structures, pay per service, or service with a non-refundable retainer fee. In any event, agents can’t earn more than their contract states even if a seller is offering more.

title: eXp Revenue Share 2.0: Increased Earnings for Agents
excerpt: Key Points: 7-Tier Revenue Share: Earn income from agents you recruit (Tier 1) down to 7 tiers. Income: Funded by eXp’s 20% commission split, not…
content:
Key Points:

  • 7-Tier Revenue Share: Earn income from agents you recruit (Tier 1) down to 7 tiers.
  • Income: Funded by eXp’s 20% commission split, not agent commissions.
  • 2024 Enhancements: Faster earnings, reduced FLQA requirements for Tiers 2-3, and Fast Start Attraction Bonuses (up to $4k per recruit).
  • Passive Wealth: Earn residual income indefinitely—even after retirement—and can will it to heirs.
  • No Recruitment Pressure: The focus remains on real estate sales. Top agents earn 6-8 figures annually from revenue share alone.
  • Support: Smart Agent Alliance offers free tools/coaching to build your network.
  • RevShare calculator: See the potential (shows the minimum payout; you can expect up to 50% higher payouts)

Welcome to eXp Revenue Share 2.0, where agents get paid just for sharing what they already love—eXp Realty.

Not sure how revenue share works, or worried eXp Realty is an MLM? It is—but not a shady one. MLM just means you earn money when agents you bring in succeed. And with eXp’s revenue share model, that success can pay you over and over again.

In 2024, eXp Realty agents earned over $200 million in rev share income, and with Revenue Share 2.0, it’s now even easier to earn faster and build real, lasting income.

The best part? With the right eXp sponsor team (that’s us), you don’t have to chase agents or host awkward coffee meetings. We do the heavy lifting—while you’re showing homes, at the beach, or watching Netflix—and still put dollars in your pocket.

Let’s break it all down: what revenue share is, how to grow it, and why our eXp revenue share calculator shows just how powerful this program can be. Here’s your hand-dandy index:

How eXp Realty Revenue Share Income Works

Huge Side Benefits to eXp Realty Revenue Share Program

Generating Multiple Streams of Income
Brilliance of eXp Realty Revenue Share Program – Everyone Wins

Who Can Earn Revenue Share Income?

How is eXp Realty’s Revenue Share Income Paid For?

eXp Realty Revenue Share Minimum Payouts & Percentages

Revenue Share 2.0 Enhancements
Explore More About eXp Revenue Share
Here’s the bottom line:
Frequently Asked Questions

How eXp Realty Revenue Share Income Works

By attracting other talented agents to join eXp Realty, you contribute to the company’s growth and earn a slice of the revenue earned by the agents you attract. While most agents naturally share their positive experiences about their brokerage, the difference at eXp Realty is that you get paid for it.

The best part? Your revenue share income comes from eXp’s company dollar—not from the new agents you bring in. This means new agents don’t have to give up part of their commissions, and your support is completely free to them. It’s a win-win for everyone involved.

How an eXp Agent Becomes an eXp Realty Sponsor

Becoming a sponsor at eXp Realty is simple. If you’ve joined eXp and another agent expresses interest in joining, all you need to do is direct them to the eXp Realty join application link and ask them to name you as their sponsor in the application. That’s it! eXp Realty automates everything from there.

What is an eXp Realty Frontline Agent?

Agents that join eXp and name you as their sponsor are known as your frontline agents or Tier 1 agents. These agents are also referred to as Front Line Qualifying Agents (FLQAs) when they are actively producing income by closing deals. You’ll earn a small percentage of their earned commissions each year until they hit their cap.

Your eXp Realty Network of Agents Expands

Your revenue share income doesn’t stop with your frontline agents. When your Tier 1 agents sponsor new agents to join eXp, those new agents become your Tier 2 agents, and you’ll earn a small percentage of their commissions as well. This pattern continues down seven tiers, creating a powerful network of agents in your downline.

As each tier of agents sponsors new producing agents, your earning potential grows exponentially. To maximize your revenue share income, you’ll need to unlock each tier by meeting specific FLQA requirements. I’ll explain that in more detail below.

Exponential Growth with Revenue Share

Revenue share income isn’t just a nice bonus—it can be life-changing. Some eXp agents are earning 6, 7, and even 8 figures annually from revenue share alone, on top of their production commissions. How does this happen? It’s all about the seven-tier structure and the cascading effect of growth.

Here’s how it works:

When you sponsor an agent directly, they become your Tier 1 agent, and you earn a percentage of their commissions. If your Tier 1 agent sponsors another agent, that new agent becomes your Tier 2 agent, and you’ll earn from their commissions too. This pattern continues down to Tier 7, creating a network of agents who contribute to your revenue share income.

Let’s break it down with numbers to show just how powerful this system can be:
Imagine you sponsor just 2 producing agents, and each of them sponsors 2 more agents, who then sponsor 2 more agents, and so on. By the time you reach Tier 7, those initial 2 agents have grown into a network of 128 agents, all contributing to your revenue share income. That’s not just income—that’s magical exponential growth!

See It in Action: Want to explore how this could work for you? Try our eXp Revenue Share Calculator to input different numbers of agents on each tier and see the minimum payout you could earn, assuming all downline agents are capping agents. It’s a powerful way to visualize the potential of eXp’s revenue share program and how it can transform your business.

Huge Side Benefits to eXp Realty Revenue Share Program

Besides the obvious benefit of earning more money, the revenue share program has other huge side benefits!

eXp Agents Can Retire and Still Get their Revenue Share Income

A key benefit of eXp revenue share income is that it can provide agent sponsors with a reliable exit plan. That is, real estate agents usually stop earning an income when they stop doing real estate transactions, but at eXp Realty, agent sponsors can retire and still get their revenue share residual income indefinitely! Wow, financial freedom!

eXp Agents Can Die and Still Provide for Loved Ones

Furthermore, an agent’s eXp revenue share income is willable. That’s right! When an agent sponsor dies, their loved ones can continue receiving the revenue share income stream. Furthermore, because of the 7-tier structure, that income may even grow larger over time. It’s a powerful way to provide ongoing financial support for family members.

Generating Multiple Streams of Income

Participating in revenue share opens up avenues for agents to generate multiple streams of income within eXp’s business model. eXp agents can also earn from commissions as real estate agents and as referral agents, and they can earn from their eXp stock purchases and awards. More about eXp income streams here.

Brilliance of eXp Realty Revenue Share Program – Everyone Wins

Let’s face it—eXp Realty’s revenue share program isn’t just good; it’s downright brilliant. Why? Because it’s designed so that everyone wins: agents, sponsors, and eXp Realty itself. It’s a model that creates incentives and support you won’t find at traditional brokerages. Here’s how it works its magic:

Agents Win: Support, Success, and Exponential Growth

Agents at eXp Realty get the best of both worlds. Not only do they earn commissions from their own real estate transactions, but they also benefit from the 7-tier sponsorship structure. Here’s the kicker: agents receive support from their “upline”—the seven sponsors above them—while also building their own downline of agents they’ve sponsored. It’s like having a built-in support system and a growing income stream, all in one.

But here’s the real gem: sponsors only earn revenue share when their downline agents are actively earning commissions. This means sponsors are incentivized to help their agents succeed. Whether it’s sharing tips, providing training, or offering mentorship, sponsors have a vested interest in seeing their downline thrive.

Pro Tip: Not all sponsors are created equal. While eXp doesn’t require sponsors to provide support, some (like Smart Agent Alliance) go above and beyond to help their agents succeed. Choosing the right sponsor can make all the difference in your revenue share journey.

Sponsors Win: Income, Impact, and Fulfillment

For sponsors, the revenue share program is a win-win. Not only do they earn extra income from their downline agents’ commissions, but they also get the satisfaction of helping others succeed. It’s not just about making money—it’s about making a difference.

Imagine this: you help an agent join eXp, and they go on to build a thriving real estate career. Then, they sponsor others, who sponsor others, and so on. Before you know it, you’ve created a ripple effect of success, and you’re earning revenue share income every step of the way. It’s like planting seeds and watching a forest grow.

eXp Wins: Happy Agents, Rapid Growth, and a Thriving Community

Of course, eXp Realty wins too. By fostering a culture of collaboration and mutual support, eXp creates an environment where agents are happy, motivated, and eager to share the opportunity with others. This has helped eXp become the fastest-growing brokerage on the planet.

But it’s not just about growth—it’s about creating a community where agents feel supported, valued, and empowered to achieve their goals. When agents win, eXp wins. And when eXp wins, agents win even more. It’s a beautiful cycle of success.

Who Can Earn Revenue Share Income?

Whether you’re a seasoned pro or just starting out in the real estate industry, you have the potential to boost your income through the powerful revenue share program offered by eXp.

New Agents to eXp Realty Can Start Immediately

One common misconception among new agents is that they need to spend months or years at eXp before they begin attracting other agents to join. However, this is not true! In fact, some sponsorship groups have devised a clever structure where experienced agents from the new agent’s upline take on much of the heavy lifting. That’s the power of Smart Agent Alliance.

Selling Houses Isn’t a Requirement

Selling houses is not necessary to earn revenue share income. Being an active real estate agent certainly has its perks, but it is not mandatory for earning a revenue share income. Agents can choose to both sell houses and sponsor agents to the company or they can choose to do one or the other.

How is eXp Realty’s Revenue Share Income Paid For?

Let’s get into the nitty-gritty of how eXp Realty’s revenue share income works—because understanding where the money comes from is key to seeing just how awesome this program is!

The Magic of eXp’s Company Dollar

Here’s the deal: your revenue share income doesn’t come out of the pockets of the agents you sponsor. Instead, it comes from eXp’s company dollar. Here’s how it breaks down:

  • Until agents hit their $16,000 cap, they earn an 80/20 commission split. That means agents keep 80% of their commissions, and eXp keeps 20%.
  • Out of that 20%, eXp is committed to paying sponsors 50% of that as revenue share income. So, when you sponsor agents, you’re earning a slice of that 10%—not from the agents themselves, but from eXp’s share.
  • Once an agent hits their cap, they keep 100% of their commissions for the rest of the year, and eXp stops collecting the 20% split. That means revenue share income is earned only while agents are working toward their cap.

How Sponsors Get Paid

Revenue share income is distributed to sponsors based on the performance of their downline agents. The more productive your downline is, the more you earn. It’s that simple. And because eXp automates the entire process, you don’t have to worry about tracking commissions or managing payments—it’s all taken care of for you.

eXp Realty Revenue Share Minimum Payouts & Percentages

This chart shows the minimum payout sponsors earn per capping agent in their downline each year. Sponsors are paid a percentage of each agent’s commissions as those commissions are being earned. Additionally, agents earn more from a bonus pool on their levels 1 – 3. In the past, that payout has been 20 – 50% higher than these minimums.

Why eXp’s Approach is Different

Here’s where eXp Realty really stands out: while most other brokerages with revenue share models advertise “maximum” payout potential, eXp does the opposite. Instead of overpromising, eXp provides minimum payout numbers, ensuring that agents have a realistic understanding of what they can earn.

In other words:

  • Other brokerages might quote inflated numbers to make their programs seem more attractive, but those numbers often don’t reflect reality.
  • eXp, on the other hand, underpromises and over-delivers. The minimum payouts are just the starting point, and the bonus pool often pushes earnings much higher.

This approach reflects eXp’s commitment to transparency and fairness. It’s not about flashy marketing—it’s about delivering real value to agents.

Profit Share vs Revenue Share

One common question is: What’s the difference between profit share and revenue share?

  • Profit Share:
    In profit share programs, earnings are distributed based on the profits of a company after expenses. This means that payouts can be less predictable and often lower, as they depend on the company’s profitability after costs. For example, Keller Williams has a profit-sharing program.  More about that below.
  • Revenue Share:
    eXp Realty’s revenue share program distributes earnings based on the revenue generated by agents, not profits. This ensures more consistent and higher payouts for agents, as it’s not dependent on the company’s expenses. Revenue share is a more transparent and lucrative model for agents, allowing them to earn more from their efforts.

Revenue Share 2.0 Enhancements

In 2024, eXp introduced several enhancements to make revenue share even more lucrative and accessible:

  1. Removal of FLQA Requirements for Tiers 2 and 3

Previously, agents needed a certain number of FLQAs to unlock Tiers 2 and 3. Now, more agents can earn from these tiers without meeting those thresholds.

  1. Fast Start Attraction Bonus

When you sponsor a new agent, you can earn 50% of the revenue share pool from their first year, up to $4,000 for fully capped agents or 5% of their Gross Commission Income (GCI) during their capping period.

  1. “Pay Now” Feature

With the “Pay Now” feature, you can instantly access your revenue share income as soon as a transaction closes—no more waiting for the monthly check. The cost? Just a $1 introductory fee. This feature has been a game-changer for agents who want more control over their finances. Whether you’re covering closing costs, investing in your business, or simply enjoying the fruits of your labor, the “Pay Now” feature ensures your money is available when you need it.

Explore More About eXp Revenue Share

If you’re curious about how eXp’s revenue share program compares to other brokerages like Keller Williams, Exit Realty, and Real Brokerage, or if you want to understand why eXp’s model is not a pyramid scheme, we’ve got you covered. For a deeper dive into these topics, check out our detailed guides:

  • eXp Revenue Share vs. Other Models – Learn how eXp’s 7-tier structure and transparent payouts set it apart from the competition.
  • Why eXp Revenue Share is NOT a Pyramid Scheme – Discover the key differences between legitimate revenue share programs and illegal pyramid schemes.
  • How Revenue Share Works for Brokers and Team Leaders – Find out how bringing your entire team to eXp can boost your income while reducing your workload.

These resources will help you understand why eXp Realty’s revenue share program is the best in the industry.

Here’s the bottom line:

The eXp Realty revenue share program isn’t just another income stream—it’s a real shot at building long-term wealth, financial freedom, and a team you don’t have to babysit. And with Revenue Share 2.0, eXp made it even easier to grow faster, earn more, and finally feel like your brokerage is actually working for you.

But here’s where things get next-level: when you partner with Smart Agent Alliance as your sponsor, you’re not doing it alone. We spend our time and money to give you tools that actually move the needle. Like your own custom agent attraction website (yep, we build it and host it for free), so you can start attracting agents while you’re out selling homes—or, let’s be honest, rewatching Selling Sunset.

We also host the video calls to convince your leads to join you as their sponsor.  Plus, we offer ongoing agent attraction training to sharpen your skills and build a real, duplicating team. This isn’t just another “rev share model”—it’s a smarter one, backed by a team that wants to see you win.

To learn more about eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance, visit SmartAgentAlliance.com, explore our free tools, or book a meeting. Let’s build something that pays you now and later.

Frequently Asked Questions

How does eXp Realty revenue share work?

eXp Realty pays agents a percentage of company revenue when agents they sponsor close deals. Earnings grow through seven tiers as your downline expands. eXp Realty’s Revenue Share 2.0 is a game-changer.

Is eXp Realty an MLM?

Yes, eXp Realty uses a multi-level compensation model (MLM), but it’s not a pyramid scheme. Agents are paid based on real production, not recruitment alone.

What is a Front Line Qualifying Agent (FLQA)?

An FLQA is an agent you sponsor who closes at least two deals or earns $5,000 in gross commission income (GCI) in six months. FLQAs help unlock tiers 4 – 7 of income.

How much can I earn with eXp revenue share?

You can earn thousands—or even six to seven figures—depending on your downline’s size and production. Try our eXp revenue share calculator to estimate your income potential.

Do I have to sell homes to earn revenue share at eXp?

No, you don’t have to sell homes to earn revenue share. You can focus solely on sponsoring agents, or do both—sell and recruit.

When is eXp Realty revenue share paid out?

eXp pays revenue share monthly, typically on the 20th. Agents can also use the Pay Now feature to cash out immediately after each transaction for a small fee.

What’s the difference between revenue share and profit share?

Revenue share pays from the company’s gross income before expenses. Profit share pays only after company costs are covered, making revenue share more consistent and transparent.

How do I become an eXp Realty sponsor?

Just have an agent list you as their sponsor when they join eXp Realty. Once that’s done, the company tracks and pays out revenue share automatically.

Can I earn revenue share from international agents?

Yes, eXp Realty’s revenue share program works globally. You can earn income from agents in all countries where eXp operates.

Is revenue share income willable if I pass away?

Yes, your eXp Realty revenue share is willable. If you pass away, your named beneficiary can continue receiving your rev share income.

Can I keep earning revenue share after I retire?

Yes, once you build your downline, you can keep earning revenue share even after you stop selling. As long as your downline is producing, you keep earning.

Are there any fees to participate in eXp revenue share?

Nope! There are no extra costs to participate. All eXp agents are automatically eligible to earn revenue share.

Does eXp Realty provide a revenue share chart?

Yes, eXp provides a revenue share chart that shows minimum payouts per capping agent on each tier. These are base numbers—actual payouts are even higher.

Does Smart Agent Alliance help agents earn revenue share?

Yes! Smart Agent Alliance builds your agent attraction website, hosts attraction calls, and gives you live training to help you grow your downline with less effort. Not sure what agents think about eXp and other brokerages, see anonymous agent reviews.

What is shared revenue in real estate?

Shared revenue means earnings are split between contributors. At eXp, it refers to the revenue split between the company and the agents who help grow it.

What is a revenue share agreement?

A revenue share agreement outlines how company revenue is shared with participants. At eXp Realty, the agreement is built into the agent’s independent contractor arrangement.

Can I build a real estate team using revenue share?

Yes. Many agents grow their own eXp Realty teams using the revenue share model. You build a network and earn from production across seven tiers.

Is there a cap on how many agents I can sponsor?

No, there’s no cap. You can sponsor as many agents as you want, and each one increases your revenue share potential.
